item.title: National Affordable Housing Trust Fund Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 224 - 194 (Roll no. 952). (text: CR H11410)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 224 - 194 (Roll no. 952).(text: CR H11410)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 223 - 195 (Roll no. 951). (consideration: CR H11412-11413)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H11412-11413)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 720, the Chair put the question of ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Hastings (WA) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum. The Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of adoption of ordering the previous question until later in the legislative day. The point of no quorum is considered as withdrawn.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 720.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H11410-11412)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 132.

All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI. It shall be in order to consider as original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Service now printed in the bill.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-369, by Ms. Castor.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-369, by Ms. Castor.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2895) to establish the National Affordable Housing Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States to provide for the construction, rehabilitation, and preservation of decent, safe, and affordable housing for low-income families.
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2895 (National Affordable Housing Trust Fund Act of 2007).
Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 2895 (National Affordable Housing Trust Fund Act of 2007).

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2895) to establish the National Affordable Housing Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States to provide for the construction, rehabilitation, and preservation of decent, safe, and affordable housing for low-income families.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
